channel.title: spectral unmixing on Jakob Schwalb-Willmann
channel.description: Recent content in spectral unmixing on Jakob Schwalb-Willmann

item.title: Spectral unmixing in R using RStoolbox
item.description: Recently, I finished the development of the first version of a spectral unmixing function being part of RStoolbox, an R package offering numerous tools for remote sensing analysis written by Benjamin Leutner. The multiple endmember spectral mixture analysis (mesma) function makes it possible to unmix multi- and hyper-spectral imagery by sets of spectral endmember profiles. Figure 1: The RStoolbox::mesma() workflow. For this, a non-negative least squares (NNLS) solver was implemented.
